Diagnosis
	1. Mixed small cell carcinoma of bladder with neuroendocrine differentiation
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Diagnostic TURBT with partial debulking

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Etoposide Jan-Mar 2024 (4 cycles)
	2. Second line Atezolizumab commenced April 2024, discontinued after 2 cycles due to progression

	Radiotherapy
	Palliative radiotherapy to T7 vertebral metastasis (20Gy/5#) completed March 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with deteriorating clinical status

	Current issues
	1. Worsening liver function (bilirubin 45, ALT 156)
	2. Increasing bone pain requiring opiate escalation
	3. Progressive fatigue - PS 3

	Summary of consultation
	This 67-year-old gentleman was diagnosed in January 2024 with mixed small cell carcinoma of bladder with extensive metastatic disease. Initial diagnostic TURBT confirmed small cell morphology with positive CD56 and Chromogranin A staining. Staging investigations revealed multiple liver metastases, bilateral pulmonary nodules, and widespread bone metastases including a symptomatic T7 lesion.

He initially responded well to first-line Carboplatin/Etoposide with partial response after 2 cycles, but developed progressive disease after cycle 4 with new liver lesions. Second-line Atezolizumab was commenced in April 2024 but discontinued after 2 cycles due to clear clinical and radiological progression with deteriorating liver function.

He has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past 4 weeks with increasing fatigue, right upper quadrant pain, and new onset jaundice. His performance status has declined from 2 to 3. Recent CT shows progressive liver metastases with new ascites.

	Further investigations
	Weekly LFTs

	Medication changes
	1. MST increased to 60mg BD
	2. Commenced Dexamethasone 4mg BD

	Follow up
	Referral made to local palliative care team
Transfer of ongoing care to local oncology unit at [redacted name] Hospital

	Required actions for receiving team
	1. Urgent palliative care review
	2. Consider third line chemotherapy options if performance status improves
	3. Weekly clinical review with LFTs
	4. Early involvement of community palliative care team
